author: Stanley Kubrick
quote: You sit at the board and suddenly your heart leaps. Your hand trembles to pick up the piece and move it. But what chess teaches you is that you must sit there calmly and think about whether it’s really a good idea and whether there are other, better ideas.

author: Stephen King
quote: It’s hard to let go. Even when what you’re holding onto is full of thorns, it’s hard to let go. Maybe especially then.

author: Stephen R. Covey
quote: Most people do not listen with the intent to understand; they listen with the intent to reply.

author: Steve Jobs
quote: People think focus means saying yes to the thing you've got to focus on. But that's not what it means at all. It means saying no to the hundred other good ideas that there are. You have to pick carefully. I'm actually as proud of the things we haven't done as the things I have done. Innovation is saying no to 1,000 things.

author: Susan Gordon Lydon
quote: Letting go is always the lesson. Have you ever noticed how much of our agony is all tied up with craving and loss?

author: Sylvia Plath
quote: Perhaps when we find ourselves wanting everything, it is because we are dangerously close to wanting nothing.

author: Tao Te Ching
quote: When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be. When I let go of what I have, I receive what I need.

author: 'Think Different' campaign, Apple
quote: Here’s to the crazy ones, the misfits, the rebels, the troublemakers, the round pegs in the square holes … the ones who see things differently — they’re not fond of rules… You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them, but the only thing you can’t do is ignore them because they change things… they push the human race forward, and while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius, because the ones who are crazy enough to think that they can change the world are the ones who do.

author: Tilopa
quote: Have a mind that is open to everything, and attached to nothing.

author: Tim Ferriss
quote: The key to not feeling rushed is remembering that lack of time is actually lack of priorities.

author: Tim Ferriss
quote: You think you're fatigued, therefore you can't exercise. In fact, you choose not to move, therefore you feel fatigued.

author: Tim Ferriss
quote: Slow down and remember this: Most things make no difference. Being busy is a form of laziness — lazy thinking and indiscriminate action.

author: Tim Ferriss
quote: Luxury, to me, is not owning a lot of stuff. Luxury, to me, is feeling unrushed.

author: Tolstoy
quote: Like all madmen, I thought everyone was mad except myself.

author: Tony Gaskin
quote: If you don't build your dreams, someone will hire you to help build theirs.

author: Unknown
quote: You all laugh because I'm different, I laugh because you are all the same.

author: Unknown
quote: The problem is not the problem. The problem is your attitude about the problem.

author: Vasudev
quote: The sign of intelligence is that you are constantly wondering. Idiots are always so sure about everything they are doing.

author: Victor Frankl
quote: When a man cannot find meaning, he numbs himself with pleasure.

author: Viktor Frankl
quote: I would define a specialist as a man who no longer sees the forest of truth for the trees of facts.

author: Vincent van Gogh
quote: I would rather die of passion than of boredom.

author: Virgil
quote: They succeed, because they think they can.

author: Voltaire
quote: The most important decision you make is to be in a good mood.

author: Walt Whitman
quote: Be curious, not judgmental.

author: Wayne W. Dyer
quote: Change the way you look at things and the things you look at change.

author: William Gibson
quote: Before you diagnose yourself with depression or low self-esteem, first make sure you are not just surrounded by assholes.

author: William James
quote: Wisdom is learning what to overlook.

author: William S. Burroughs
quote: Your mind will answer most questions if you learn to relax and wait for the answer.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: To be, or not to be: that is the question: Whether ’tis nobler in the mind to suffer the slings and arrows of outrageous fortune, or to take arms against a sea of troubles…

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Expectation is the root of all heartache.

author: Woody Guthrie
quote: Life has got a habit of not standing hitched. You got to ride it like you find it. You got to change with it.

author: Zen Proverb
quote: Let go, or be dragged.

author: Zig Ziglar
quote: When you focus on your problems you’ll have more problems. When you focus on the possibilities you’ll have opportunities.
